Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: The Slovenian business has demonstrated a reduction in consumption (12%) from installing solar arrays on four (soon to be five) sites. Production of energy from installed solar arrays improved with the reduction in the rain across large parts of eastern Australia, with output growing to 7,800 megawatt hours against last year's figure of 6,848 megawatt hours. Average generation per array also improved to 116.7-megawatt hours, up from 113-megawatt hours per annum.

column6: Waste generated
Waste diverted from disposal
column13: Relevant members of the consolidated entity have continued to work with suppliers and global recycling/product stewardship schemes to provide consumers with simple solutions to recycle their old products and divert waste from landfills. Each region has reported the successful diversion of a substantial portion of its waste streams from landfills and the operation of product stewardship schemes.

Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
column13: Regulatory changes result in increased reporting and emissions reduction requirements, posing a non-compliance risk. HVN maps current and emerging regulatory changes for each jurisdiction. Harvey NormanÃÂ® operates and implements a framework to ensure compliance with regulatory obligations by each controlled entity.

column8: Transition to low carbon economy scenario
column13: In the transition to a low carbon economy, the costs of items and materials from suppliers may significantly increase, resulting in reduced availability of goods and increased costs passed through from our suppliers. The current controls are Monitoring unexpected or significant price increases from suppliers, Market trend analysis of sectors most exposed to transition and physical climate risks, and Suppliers making arrangements to mitigate this risk.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In Australia, the Connect Intranet site is a staff information source. New business staff are also highlighted here, including a story about one new employee each month, asking them questions about themselves and their hobbies.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: The Company has an induction program for new Directors. The Nomination Committee, assisted by the Company Secretary, are responsible for developing and implementing the program. The program is reviewed and tailored for each new Director appointed to the Board.

column13: HVN committed to a review of our Parental Leave Policy. In FY23, HVN report the following statistics about parental leave and return to work, reporting a 92% return to work ratio following parental leave by men and women.

Occupation health and safety management system
column13: HVN continued to strive to learn, improve and positively influence their physical and psychological health and safety by enhancing our Health and Safety Framework and 2022-2025 Health and Safety Strategy. The framework under the four pillars of Leadership, Governance, People & Culture and Risk Management.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: In FY23, a technology solution was approved to support the management and reporting of Health & Safety programs across global operations to enhance capability and performance further. Implementation of this solution will commence in FY24.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Enhanced governance, planning, and reporting have been implemented within each country where HVN operates, and improvements continue to be implemented across HVN's controlled entities in Australia. A focus on reviewing critical risks and enhancing controls has been conducted with the controlled entities in Australia.

column6: Occupational health services
column13: HVN cares about our people and the communities we serve worldwide and continually strives to learn, improve and positively influence their physical and psychological health and safety. Relevant controlled entities continue to undertake a range of training opportunities across Health and Safety.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: In Australia, a Wellbeing Working Group has been formed. This group aim to participate actively in consultation around Wellbeing and Engagement initiatives.
column21: Wellbeing Working Group, health and safety, engagement

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Training and education opportunities have been undertaken with leadership teams, management and employees to continue encouraging participation as an essential foundation of continuous improvement and safety improvement.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: In FY23, relevant controlled entities continued to undertake a range of training opportunities across Health and Safety. Focus areas included mental health, discrimination, harassment and workplace bullying, workplace drugs, alcohol and gambling, identifying hazards and managing risks.
